creator: david.cheong@clear.co.nz
text:
Hi, When the with * tag is used the appropriate attributes of the Bean are assigned to the values of the request as required. However when a particular form element is cleared and the form is resubmitted, the Bean attributes are not correspondingly cleared. Here is an example code in Samepage.jsp: <% out.println(request.getParameter("attribute1") + "
"); %>

Attribute 1: >


Attribute 1: Actual output ============= When the attribute1 form element has value "Test value", a Submit produces: - output from request = "Test value" - attribute1 form element = "Test value" - testBean.getAttribute1() = "Test value" When the attribute1 form element is cleared, a Submit produces - - output from request = - attribute1 form element = "Test value" - testBean.getAttribute1() = "Test value" Is that a real bug and if so has it been fixed in version 3.2+? If it isn't a bug why is there an inconsistent behaviour? Thanks, dave

Though it complicates using <jsp:setProperty ... property="*" />, this behavior
is required by the JSP 1.1 spec.

Under section 2.13.2.1, you will find:

    property     The name of the Bean property whose value you want to set

        If you set propertyName to * then the tag will iterate over the
        current ServletRequest parameters, matching parameter names
        and value type(s) to property names and setter method type(s), setting
        each matched property to the value of the matching parameter. If a
        parameter has a value of ““, the corresponding property is not
        modified.

The relavent sentence is the last one.  Thus, this isn't a bug but spec'd
behavior.

FYI: I believe Tomcat 3.1.1 probably has the bug where:

<jsp:setProperty name="someBean" property="someProperty" value="" />

won't call the set method either.  This was fixed in Tomcat 3.2 and later.
